title: How to Cancel Your AT&T Wireless Plan by Phone or Online

steps.title: Call 800-331-0500 from any phone.
steps.content: Call 800-331-0500 from any phone. If you're calling from an AT&T Wireless phone, you can simply dial 611 . Alternatively, you can visit an AT&T Wireless store or kiosk. [1] X Research source You can also call this number to suspend your wireless account during military service.

steps.title: Choose the language in which you'd like to proceed.
steps.content: Choose the language in which you'd like to proceed. English and Spanish are available on the electronic system.

steps.title: Say "Cancel service" when prompted.
steps.content: Say "Cancel service" when prompted. This will direct you to the correct line so a representative can help you.

steps.title: Say your AT&T Wireless account or phone number.
steps.content: Say your AT&T Wireless account or phone number. You need either of these to proceed.

steps.title: Follow the prompts to complete the cancellation process.
steps.content: Follow the prompts to complete the cancellation process. If your account has a balance, you might owe money.

steps.title: Go to https://www.att.com/support/wireless/ and select Chat.
steps.content: Go to https://www.att.com/support/wireless/ and select Chat . The chat feature isn't always available, so this option isn't as reliable as calling. If you live in Illinois or New York and signed up for service online, you might be able to cancel your wireless service online at https://att.com/myatt . [2] X Research source

steps.title: What do you need to cancel?
steps.content: What do you need to cancel? Get your AT&T account number or phone number.

steps.title: What is an early termination fee?
steps.content: What is an early termination fee? An early termination fee (ETF) may apply if you cancel before your service agreement ends. You won't have an ETF if you have an installment plan, and will instead pay off the remaining balance of the installment plan. [3] X Research source To estimate your ETF, go to your account overview and go to My devices > Manage device > Device info . You will have an ETF if you sign a contract for 1-2 years and cancel after having service for over 14 days for a personal account or 30 days for a business account. You won't have an ETF if you're on an installment plan or Equipment Installed Plan.

steps.title: How to cancel an AT&T wireless contract without penalty?
steps.content: How to cancel an AT&T wireless contract without penalty? You won't have an ETF if you cancel your plan before 14 days for a personal account or 30 days for a business account. You must also return the equipment in like-new condition
